attributes.Title: Ideas That Change the World
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Honors College
201
UMass Amherst
In this seminar, students will examine texts and works of art that have profoundly shaped the world we live in. The course is divided into four units: Models of Inquiry; the Impact of Science and Technology; Social Philosophy and Civic Engagement; and Art in the World. The course is supplemented with several plenary lectures by distinguished honors faculty speakers.
This course is open to Commonwealth Honors College students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
16389

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Hebrew
110
UMass Amherst

Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61994

attributes.Title: Intermediate Modern Hebrew II
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Hebrew
240
UMass Amherst
Continuation of HEBREW 230. Further work in Hebrew conversation, listening, reading, and writing. Introduction to Hebrew word-formation. Adapted short stories, videotapes. Language lab.
Pre Req: HEBREW 230  Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61976
Requisite: Pre Req: HEBREW 230  Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.

attributes.Title: Modern Hebrew Lit I
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Hebrew
361
UMass Amherst
Introduction to the modern Hebrew short story and to modern Hebrew poetry starting from the "Revival" period, with a concentration on Israeli short stories. Some Israeli nonfiction (satire, journalistic writing, etc.). Videotapes introducing Hebrew literary works and Israeli culture.
PreReq:  Hebrew 351  or by consent of instructor
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
78294

attributes.Title: Elementary Biblical Hebrew I
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Hebrew
111
UMass Amherst
Fundamentals of classical Hebrew grammar and vocabulary, introduced through the reading of select biblical texts.  Language lag, written and oral assignments, quizzes, tests.  No previous background in Hebrew necessary.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Hebrew through the Media II
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Hebrew
345
UMass Amherst
Continuation of Hebrew 343. Instruction of Hebrew through the use of: clips from Israeli feature films and from other video sources (TV programs, documentaries, etc.); radio broadcasts, popular songs and other audio recordings; newspaper items; and multimedia computer programs.  Most materials will be web-based, some on CD's/DVD's.  When available, the resources used will include interactive assignments.  A variety of proficiency levels will be accommodated, but at least three semesters of Hebrew are required.
HEBREW240,246,301,302,352...  Pre- Requisites or Instructor Consent.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
39586
Requisite: HEBREW240,246,301,302,352...  Pre- Requisites or Instructor Consent.

attributes.Title: Modern Hebrew Lit II
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Hebrew
362
UMass Amherst
Gradual introduction to literary forms other than short stories and poems, particularly novels and drama. Some readings from the "Revival" period; mostly more recent Israeli novelists and playwrights. Selected nonfiction pieces (satire, journalistic writing, etc.). Videotapes introducing Hebrew literary works and Israeli culture.
Pre Req: HEBREW 240 OR 246  Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
17854
Requisite: Pre Req: HEBREW 240 OR 246  Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Hebrew
298
UMass Amherst
For advanced students in Hebrew. Application of knowledge of the language to a teaching or tutoring situation. Student submits proposal of project to instructor, and supplies weekly lesson plans and lesson evaluations. Summary report and evaluation of project required. Mandatory Pass/Fail.
Varies from 1 to 18 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
